---

The dependency conflict is caused by mismatched versions of Vitest and its plugins in your `package.json`. Specifically:

- `vitest` is set to `^3.2.2` (allowing up to `3.2.x`)
- `@vitest/coverage-v8` is `^3.2.2`
- `@vitest/ui` is pinned to exactly `3.2.3`

The `@vitest/ui@3.2.3` package requires Vitest `3.2.3` as a peer dependency, but your setup allows/uses `3.2.4`, causing the resolution failure.

To fix this, update `@vitest/ui` to use a caret range matching the others. Here's the suggested change to your `package.json`:

```json
// ...existing code...
    "@vitest/ui": "^3.2.2",
// ...existing code...
```

After making this change, run `pnpm install` (or `npm install` if you prefer, but the project uses pnpm as noted in the README). This should resolve the conflict.

If you still encounter issues installing pnpm globally, try `npm install -g pnpm` from outside the project directory, or use an alternative installer like `iwr https://get.pnpm.io/install.ps1 -useb | iex` on Windows PowerShell.
